Arduino

Embedded Systems Engineering - Or Making an Led Blink.

What makes Arduino so great is that the projects you create, the code you write, can do so much more than move pixels on a screen. With Arduino, you can build pretty much any hardware project you can think of, whether it be a robotic arm like the one I designed for SPEAR or a video game complete with controls, sounds and a display.

The two big projects I've built with Arduino has been a robotic arm (see SPEAR section) and a virtual rendition of one of my favourite childhood games, Lunar Lander. This old atari game was featured in the Telus World Of Science and each time I visited it I would always play hours of it. Christmas break 2017 I decided I would create my own version using Arduino.

A Video of the original game can be found here. See my Github for my version!

For the geeks out there: Arduino is library built using C++. The library is designed to be used on Arduino microcontrollers. These microcontrollers can be used to interface with all different kinds of hardware such as sensors, joysticks and displays. They are a great resource to learn embedded systems programming. Their website can be found here.
